1.heading: Manjeshwar, Saguna.
1.title: "How to Whiten Charcoal"
1.author: illustrations, Ram Waeerkar ; adapted from the folktale as told by the late Saguna Manjeshwar
1.appears_in: p. 25-28 in Tinkle Digest, no. 12 (1992, 2009 printing).
notes: Begins: "One day Bhonduram found a piece of charcoal on the street."

2.heading: Manji.
2.title: Mugen no Jûnin
2.author: Samura Hiroaki.
notes: Summary (by Jordan Taylor): Mugen no Jûnin follows Manji, an almost completely immortal samurai. Kept alive by the 'kessen-chû,' bloodworms that sacrifice their own bodies to heal the wounds of their host. Manji is on a quest to atone for his past crimes and end his life.

"It's been three years since the Decepticons overran our planet and caused massive destruction. Now, the Earth has been rebuilt, the Autobots are in hiding."

12.heading: Mankind.
12.title: "The Homecoming"
12.author: writer, Archie Goodwin ; artist, Al Williamson
notes: "Mankind was locked into the solar system by some unseen enemy. The only solution was to explore Earth's parallel worlds for the one unguarded by the aliens!"

13.heading: Mankind.
13.title: "The Hope of Mankind?"
13.author: [No author]
13.series: Space: 1999) text p. 46-47 in Space: 1999, no. 2

14.heading: Mankind.
14.title: "I Saved Mankind"
14.author: pencils, John Forte
notes: Summary: A man drives off aliens attempting to pour canisters into water reservoirs. The contents would have made people immune to disease.
Data from Bob Klein, Lou Mougin, Martin O'Hearn, et al. via Grand Comics Database.

15.heading: Mankind.
15.title: "In the Year 3971"
15.author: Justin Green
notes: "Mankind was still around but had to share his planet with millions of Venusians."

16.heading: Mankind.
16.title: "Judas"
16.author: story, Rich Margopoulos ; art, Rich Corben
notes: "They came in droves. Indestructible metal conquerors, ready to enslave all of mankind. Only an explosion massive enough to destroy the entire world, could save it!"

17.heading: Mankind.
17.title: "The Last Hero!"
17.author: story, Steve Skeates ; art, Ramon Torrents
notes: "Robots! Servants to a mankind grown lazy! Robots! The target of the Baldies, revolutionary terrorists in a topsy-turvy future world! Robots! A dying race of humanoids in need of the last hero!"

18.heading: Mankind.
18.title: Life Quest
18.author: written and illustrated by Matt Vander Pol; edited by James Pruett, Dorothy Vander Pol.
notes: Began with no 1 (Dec. 1997).

Summary (from OCLC): It has been revealed to Samuel Merity that his daughter, 12-year-old Sarah, is to be the bearer of the seed that will bring about the restoration of mankind. A hard calling though, for Sarah and her friend, Ridge, must carry this seed into the heart of one of the most dreaded lands on this ravaged end-times earth.
Indicia title: Lifequest.

19.heading: Mankind.
19.title: "The Plotters!"
19.author: art by Sheldon Moldoff
19.appears_in: p. 250-252 in Marvel Masterworks presents Atlas Era Menace (New York : Marvel Publishing, 2009) ; reprinted from Menace, no. 10 (Mar. 1954).
notes: Begins: "You are a sociologist and mankind is your special field of study! You lead a team of underground workers bent on finding a way to overcome the people of the strongest nation in the world! For once that nation falls, the others fall, and then you rule the world!"
A story about ants.

20.heading: Mankind.
20.title: The Races of Mankind
20.author: by Ruth Benedict and Gene Weltfish.
notes: (Public Affairs Pamphlet ; no. 85)
The illustrations are signed "R" or "Reinhardt".

21.heading: Mankind.
21.title: Seikai Trilogy
21.author: original story by Hiroyuki Morioka ; composition by Aya Yoshinaga ; art by Toshihiro Ono ; translation, Bryan Masumoto ; English adaptation, Dan Borses.

contents.title: v. 2. Banner of the Stars. The Shape of Bonds
v. 3. Banner of the Stars II. Protecting the Precious.

notes: Based on the author's science fiction novels, presents the story of a future universe where mankind has spread throughout the stars and war is immanent between the dominant Humankind Empire Abh and a coalition of rivals led by the United Mankind.
Complete in 3 vols.

22.heading: Mankind.
22.title: "Survivor or Savior!"
22.author: story, Steve Skeates ; art, Gonzalo Mayo
notes: "A man from the far future pays a visit to San Francisco. The success or failure of his mission will determine the fate of mankind."

notes: Summary: A businessman who dislikes humanity finds one day that he loses his ability to see them.

27.title: "Its Captain, Samar, Had Suffered a Mortal Injury"

notes: Summary: The captain's three sons take command of the Karkar: Kukulkan, Manko and Impak. They sail West.

28.heading: Manko.
28.title: "The Natives Treated the Three Brothers Kindly"
28.author: by William Ritt and Clarence Gray.
notes: Summary: We are hearing the "legendary story of Titania," told by Akka. Kukulkan falls in love and stays in the new land to become chief of the Mayas, but Manko and Impak voyage on.

29.title: "Manko and Impak Sailed Around What is Now Known as South America"
29.author: by William Ritt and Clarence Gray.
notes: Summary: Manko teaches agriculture to the ancient Peruvians, and stays to become king, while Impak sails on.

68.heading: Manley, Mike, 1961-
68.title: Seven the Hard Way
68.author: writer, Daniel Way ; pencils, Doug Braithwaite ; inks & washes, Bill Reinhold, with Doug Braithwaite (Issue #43), Gary Erskine (Issue #44) & Mike Manley (Issue #45) ; colors, Andy Troy ; letters, Virtual Calligraphy's Cory Petit.
notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 27 cm.
(Wolverine Origins)
"Contains material originally published in magazine form as Wolverine: Origins #41-45."

"In the fight of his life against his most fearsome foe, Wolverine finally realizes he can't go it alone. It's time to assemble an alliance that will help him take out Romulus and give him a shred of a chance at redeeming his son, Daken. His dream team seven strong, it starts with Bruce Banner and his gamma-irradiated progeny, Skaar, and it gets harder, much harder, from there!"
